comment.body: I would update this screenshot with something in production. I was grabbing this from a Figma file, which also included the CDN cache purging work, but this is not available to customers.

pull_request.title: Front end sites v1 pipeline docs updates
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This pull request documents changes to the build pipeline of Front-End Sites. Before merging, I would like to fully cut over the Docs site itself to the v1 pipeline. We've had a few branches and test PRs run on it seemingly successfully for a few weeks.

## Effect

* Adds a new page specific to the [v1 pipeline](https://pr-8737-documentation.appa.pantheon.site/guides/decoupled/overview/v1-pipeline)
* Modifies a few related pages

## Remaining Work and Prerequisites

- [ ] Switch the docs site itself to use `any` as the value for this environment variable as a show of confidence in the change.

### Dependencies and Timing

The product work is already done. @jsulz and I want this PR merged by Friday, November 3rd at the latest because there will be an email sent to customers starting on Monday, November 6th, referencing this documentation. The sooner we can make functional links, the better.

issue.title: Environment Configuration Doc Update
issue.body:
Re: [Environment Configuration](https://docs.pantheon.io/guides/environment-configuration/read-environment-config)

Priority: Low

## Issue Description:
Both DB_HOST and PORT under the $_ENV variable don't provide the correct value.
Based on this doc, I should get something like string(9) "XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX" for DB_HOST, but I only get 'dbhost' for DB_HOST and '6033' for the PORT which is different from what I see in "Connection info" under site dashboard..

pull_request.title: Relaunch Procedure Updates
pull_request.body:
[Relaunch Existing Pantheon Site](https://docs.pantheon.io/relaunch) Updates: 

- Add a section describing the expected experience of a relaunch (document 404 Unknown Site expectation) 
- Add an FAQ about how Domain Verification impacts the established relaunch procedure
- Update existing content in the relaunch doc that discusses HTTPS interruption, and instead discuss 404 Unknown Site error 
- Remove warnings about waiting for HTTPS to provision before updating DNS, remove instructions to clear caches in the old and new site dashboards 

[Custom Domains](https://docs.pantheon.io/guides/domains/custom-domains) Update: 
- Crosslink to FAQ about how Domain Verification impacts the established relaunch procedure

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,20 @@ The relaunch process applies exclusively to live sites already hosted on Pantheo
 
 ## Prepare for Relaunch
 
+### Expected Disruption
+
+During this procedure, there will be a very brief period of disruption where requests to the custom domain will serve a `404 Unknown Site` error.
+
+The `404 Unknown Site` error will be returned as soon as the custom domain is removed from the old site, and once connected to the new site dashboard requests will immediately start to return a `200 OK` status once again. Requests will start routing to the new site dashboard after the TTL for the DNS records expires.
+
+There is no risk of HTTPS interruption during the relaunch procedure. Since launched domains already have a valid certificate, the existing certificate is served and valid until a new one is provisioned and deployed by the platform.
comment.body: @rachelwhitton This sentence coupled with the previous sentences may be confusing to some readers. I guess what you are trying to inform is that while the users will see 404s, there is no need to reupload/attach certs during the relaunch procedure. Technically, "HTTPS" traffic will be interrupted since 404s basically is an interruption to the customer's traffic. Am I understanding this correctly ?

pull_request.title: Relaunch Procedure Updates
pull_request.body:
[Relaunch Existing Pantheon Site](https://docs.pantheon.io/relaunch) Updates: 

- Add a section describing the expected experience of a relaunch (document 404 Unknown Site expectation) 
- Add an FAQ about how Domain Verification impacts the established relaunch procedure
- Update existing content in the relaunch doc that discusses HTTPS interruption, and instead discuss 404 Unknown Site error 
- Remove warnings about waiting for HTTPS to provision before updating DNS, remove instructions to clear caches in the old and new site dashboards 

[Custom Domains](https://docs.pantheon.io/guides/domains/custom-domains) Update: 
- Crosslink to FAQ about how Domain Verification impacts the established relaunch procedure

issue.body:
<!--
Pull requests should be opened in a branch off the `main` branch.

For more information on contributing to Pantheon documentation:
- [Contributor Guidelines](https://docs.pantheon.io/contribute)
- [Style Guide](https://docs.pantheon.io/style-guide)
- and the [Google developer documentation style guide](https://developers.google.com/style) for formatting recommendations when contributing to the docs.

**Note:** Please fill out the PR template to ensure proper processing and release timing. If you're not sure about a section, leave it empty.
-->

Closes #

## Summary

<!-- Do not remove this section.

Example format: [Pantheon User Account Login Session Length](https://docs.pantheon.io/user-dashboard#pantheon-user-account-login-session-length)** - Adds action that Terminus users are also logged out after 24 hours of inactivity.
-->

**[Doc Page Title](https://docs.pantheon.io/doc-title)** - <Enter a one sentence summation of the pertinent changes (including not-yet-completed work) provided by this PR.>

## Effect

<!-- Use this section to detail the changes summarized above, or remove if not needed -->

The following changes are already committed:

*
*

## Remaining Work and Prerequisites

<!-- Remove if not needed -->
The following changes still need to be completed:

- [ ] List any outstanding work here

### Dependencies and Timing

<!-- If this PR relies on other work before it should be merged or if it should be merged after a certain date, detail that here. -->

- [ ] Other prerequisites that must be completed before merging this PR

**Release**:
- [ ] When ready
- [ ] After date: $DATE

--------------------------------------------------

## Post Launch

**Do not remove** - To be completed by the docs team upon merge:

- [ ] Redirect `/old-path/` => `/new-path/` (if applicable)
- [ ] Include/exclude pages ^ respectively within docs search service provider (if applicable)
- [ ] For Heroes - add a props post to the [discussion board](https://discuss.pantheon.io/c/pantheon-platform/documentation/17).
- [ ] Remove from the [project board](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/documentation/projects/14)

issue.title: Terminus Guide Doc Link
issue.body:
Re: [Terminus Guide](https://docs.pantheon.io/terminus/install)

Priority: Low

## Issue Description:
link to homebrew instructions is off.

Moreover this guide lacks hierarchy and advice on a clear and recommended install path for those in a hurry.

## Suggested Resolution
